title: Cucumber Kimchi (Oi Kimchi)
ingredients: 3Lebanese cucumbers (450 g / 1 pound), other cucumber suitable for pickling is ok to use, rinsed
50g garlic chives (1.7 ounces), chopped in same length as the cucumber
KIMCHI SAUCE (MIX THESE WELL IN A BOWL)
1Tbsp grated red apple or asian pear
1/2Tbsp Korean salted shrimps , minced (if you donâ€™t have this add more fish sauce below)
directions: Cut off both ends of the cucumber. Divide the cucumber into 3 pieces then cross cut the pieces length ways. You should result with 4 to 5 cm (1.5 inch) length cucumber pieces. Put the cucumber into a large bowl then scatter the coarse sea salt around on top. Gently mix them so that the cucumber gets pickled evenly. Set it aside for 20 minutes.

Gently brush off the salt from the cucumber then transfer the cucumber into a clean bowl. Pour in the kimchi sauce then mix them gently. Add the garlic chives then mix with the rest again. Transfer into a glass container.
Keep it at room temperature for about 12 to 24 hours then move it to the fridge. Serve once chilled.
